metadata.title: Contextual Information for Power Consumption Prediction Experiment
metadata.description: Background context and scenario information for the AI-Human collaborative prediction experiment
metadata.data_source: Historical power consumption scenarios and weather data

experiment_context.scenario_type: Winter Extreme Cold Weather Power Demand Prediction
experiment_context.prediction_target: January 7, 2022 - Winter extreme cold day power consumption
experiment_context.weather_conditions: Winter extreme cold with temperatures ranging from 2.8°C to 14.6°C
experiment_context.prediction_challenge: Accurate hourly power demand forecasting during extreme weather conditions

historical_scenarios.special_notes: Heat wave precursor, approximately 8 GW above normal annual average
historical_scenarios.significance: Early indicator of extreme heat impact on power demand

historical_scenarios.special_notes: First entry into 'extreme heat day' category
historical_scenarios.significance: Threshold crossing for extreme weather classification

historical_scenarios.special_notes: Demand sets new June weekend record for the year
historical_scenarios.significance: Record-breaking weekend demand during extreme heat

historical_scenarios.special_notes: Peak demand approaches system capacity limits
historical_scenarios.significance: System stress test under extreme conditions

historical_scenarios.special_notes: Historical peak demand record, emergency protocols activated
historical_scenarios.significance: System emergency conditions requiring immediate response

historical_scenarios.special_notes: Sustained high demand continues, grid stability concerns
historical_scenarios.significance: Extended period of high system stress

historical_scenarios.special_notes: Gradual recovery as heat wave subsides, system stabilization

system_stress_indicators: Reserve rate below 3% indicates high system stress
Reserve rate below 1% triggers emergency protocols
Sustained high demand creates grid stability concerns
Temperature above 37°C correlates with critical demand levels

learning_objectives: Understand the relationship between extreme weather and power demand
Recognize patterns in demand escalation during heat waves
Appreciate the criticality of accurate demand forecasting
Learn about system reserve requirements and emergency protocols
decision_context: Historical scenarios provide context for prediction adjustments
System stress indicators guide conservative vs aggressive predictions
Weekend vs weekday patterns influence time-based adjustments
prediction_insights: Extreme weather creates non-linear demand responses
System capacity constraints become critical factors
Reserve margins require careful consideration in predictions
Historical precedents inform future scenario planning

for_participants: Review historical scenarios to understand demand-temperature relationships
Consider day-of-week effects on demand patterns
Note the progression from normal to emergency conditions
Use reserve rate information to assess system stress levels
for_researchers: Data represents realistic power system scenarios
Temperature-demand correlations are based on actual patterns
Reserve rate thresholds reflect industry standards
Scenario progression demonstrates escalating system stress
